page.title: 11Colwall Women's Institute
page.content: Colwall W.I. began in 1930 and has a membership now of 65. Members meet monthly and recent projects include rebuilding seats and painting bus shelters for the Best Kept Village competition and improving Colwall railway station in a joint scheme with B.R. The W.I. has also run a campaign to encourage support for local shops by supplying car-stickers. Activities include drama, a rounders team, a bowling team and an annual pancake race. They also run classes for craftwork, flower arranging and spinning. The age range of members varies from 26 to 87 and it is a sign of the times that most members under 60 are in full or part-time employment. Unlike more rural W.I.'s, Colwall has a high percentage of professional and business women.
